cancel().Description: Instructs the WebView to cancel the authentication request.

Returns: whether the credentials are suitable for use
useHttpAuthUsernamePassword().Description: Gets whether the credentials stored for the current host (i.e. the host for which @B_android#webkit#WebViewClient#onReceivedHttpAuthRequest_E@ was called) are suitable for use. Credentials are not suitable if they have previously been rejected by the server for the current request.

proceed(java.lang.String, java.lang.Stri.Description: Instructs the WebView to proceed with the authentication with the given credentials. Credentials for use with this method can be retrieved from the WebView's store using @B_android#webkit#WebView#getHttpAuthUsernamePassword_E@.
proceed(java.lang.String, java.lang.Stri.FullName: public void proceed (String username, String password)

proceed(java.lang.String,java.lang.Strin.Description: Instructs the WebView to proceed with the authentication with the given credentials. Credentials for use with this method can be retrieved from the WebView's store using @B_android#webkit#WebView#getHttpAuthUsernamePassword_E@.
proceed(java.lang.String,java.lang.Strin.FullName: public void proceed (String username, String password)

ClassDesc: Represents a request for HTTP authentication. Instances of this class are created by the WebView and passed to @B_android#webkit#WebViewClient#onReceivedHttpAuthRequest_E@. The host application must call either @B_android#webkit#HttpAuthHandler#proceed_E@ or @B_android#webkit#HttpAuthHandler#cancel_E@ to set the WebView's response to the request.
